title: Children's Party Entertainer
description:
Job Summary
At Mad Science we are have a blast. Build and fly rockets, demonstrate lasers,  explore the states of matter using dry ice, and help children create slime and other polymers. You will inspire the next generation of scientists through our innovative activities that show kids what science is really all about.

We are currently looking for OUTGOING and EXCITING people to perform MAD SCIENCE PARTIES and SHOWS! Are you looking for a job that's FUN and gives you loads of EXPERIENCE in the spotlight? Look no further than MAD SCIENCE! You'll visit schools, libraries, camps, homes and more to deliver AMAZING science presentations that will WOW your audiences.                      We provide the training and equipment, and handle all the booking and scheduling from our office. All you do is go have fun with the kids! Shows and parties happen ALL THE TIME! This is a part-time job, but we prefer someone with a flexible schedule who can take on many gigs when given plenty of notice. Requirements:
  • An OUTGOING and DYNAMIC personality
  • Enjoys performing in front of an audience 
  • Experience with groups of children ages 4-12
  • Some experience in theater a plus.
  • Reliable transportation (A MUST!)
  • A cell phone
  • Excellent verbal communication skills
  • Ability to lift up to 45 lbs
  • Must be available evenings and weekends
  • Knowledge of basic science (don't worry - we'll train the rest!)
  • Lots of ENERGY
  • All employees are required to submit a Vulnerable Sector Screening at time of hiring
Successful candidates are also:
  • Responsible - able to conduct programs safely and efficiently
  • Reliable - always on time, always prepared
  • Adaptable - able to adjust to every environment and group type
  • Professional - comfortable dealing with everyone from parents to principals
  • Flexible - able to function in a business where schedules and workloads are at the mercy of the customer
  • FUN!!!
COVID-19 Safety : The Health & Safety of our staff and clients is our top priority.  Applicants are required to be fully vaccinated to be considered for employment.

title: Volunteer - Entertainer
description:
Job Description :

 

 

ENTERTAINER

Amica The Glebe

 

 

 

 

 

Amica Senior Lifestyles is setting a new standard for senior living in Canada by combining unparalleled premium hospitality and amenities with expert care and support to deliver a personalized senior living experience. Committed to enriching the lives of seniors now and as their needs change, Amica offers Independent Living (IL), Assisted Living (AL) and Memory Care (MC) lifestyle options. Established in 1996, the company owns and operates over 30 residences in British Columbia, Alberta and Ontario, with plans to continue expansion in select markets.

 

 

 

A day in the life of an Entertainer

You visit the residence and provide entertainment to a group. You can engage Residents of all abilities in your performance, and provide a repertoire that is appropriate for the demographic. You take pride in connecting and sharing your craft with the Residents.

 

 

Responsibilities and Duties:

You will interact with the Life enrichment team in providing entertainment for our Residents. This may include:

  • Providing entertainment to groups on our different neighbourhoods (Independent Living, Assisted Living and/ or Memory Care)
  • Support Residents in learning a new skill- ex. Teaching guitar, or piano, or ukulele
  • Engaging Residents of all abilities during performance
  • Providing a repertoire that is appropriate to the group

 

Qualifications:

As an Entertainer you demonstrate the following:

  • Passion for providing high quality entertainment to seniors
  • Good verbal communication in English (or other language as required)
  • Proficiency and skill in your genre/ instrument/ skill set
  • Ability to continue performing when there are distractions

Based on the frequency and location of your visits, each volunteer may be required to provide:

  • A Vulnerable Sector Screening from the Police/ RCMP
  • A clear TB test

COVID 19 Protocols:

  • All volunteers will follow COVID 19 protocols in the Residence in alignment with the Team Member strategy (may include masking, hand hygiene training, etc.)

 

Preferred Experience:

  • Experience spending time with seniors (family members, community members, etc.)
  • Experience performing for seniors (community centre, retirement home, long term care, etc.)
  • Looking for:
    • Musicians
      • Individual or group performers
      • Who are interested in teaching seniors their craft
      • Young students looking to practice in front of an audience
    • Other performers    
      • Musicians, jugglers, clowns, comedians, acting groups, etc.

 

Commitment Expected:

We are flexible around commitment and timing for performers- may vary from once or twice per year, to weekly depending on Resident preference.

Duration: Performances typically last between 30 minutes and 1 hour each. Please expect to arrive in advance to welcome attendees and ensure proper set up.

 

 

Training:

We support a vulnerable group of seniors, and as such you may be asked to complete a training process that includes:

  • In person support including:
    • Behaviour management- what to do if you see a Resident experiencing a behavior
    • Emergency Preparedness- should there be an emergency when you are onsite
    • Supporting Residents with Cognitive Aging- Our Residents are all at different places in their aging experience, and some need additional support. We have modules to help you learn how to support and get comfortable with interacting with Residents who may be more forgetful or need more prompting.  
  • Support from our Life Enrichment Coordinator and Team
    • Each LEC helps to guide and support the Entertainers around the needs required for the event
    • Regular touch bases to make sure you have what you need, get your feedback and recommendations.
  • Residence Orientation
    • To help you understand the different areas that are available
    • To prepare and understand what to do in case of emergency

title: Artiste de foules
description:
Description de l'entreprise

En tant qu’entreprise fondée et dirigée par un artiste, notre mission est d'offrir aux talents la liberté et les ressources dont ils ont besoin afin de favoriser la réalisation de travail de qualité et de prospérer dans un environnement amusant et créatif.

Description du poste

L’Artiste de foules crée des structures de programmation de simulations pour composer des foules, dans le respect des exigences de qualité élevées de Rodeo FX.

Principales responsabilités

  • Créer des structures de programmation de simulations pour composer des foules réalistes ;
  • Exécuter des simulations dans les plans et prendre en compte les notes éventuelles ;
  • Travailler en étroite collaboration avec le.la Superviseur.e en images de synthèse et le.la Chef.fe des foules pour trouver des solutions et des approches créatives et techniques qui améliorent les prises de vue, tout en respectant les spécifications et les délais du projet ; 
  • Si nécessaire, participer au développement d'outils et de techniques pour le département ;
  • Effectuer un contrôle de qualité pour s’assurer que toutes les normes techniques et créatives soient respectées sur les prises de vue avant leur soumission pour révision et approbation, et intégrer rapidement les modifications demandées ;
  • Tenir la production et l'équipe de projet informées de l'état d'avancement du travail, des enjeux à résoudre et des ramifications des problèmes rencontrés, recommander des solutions potentielles ;
  • Veiller au respect des échéances et informer rapidement l'équipe de projet si des délais additionnels sont à prévoir.
Qualifications

  • Expérience dans un poste similaire dans l'industrie VFX ;
  • Excellente connaissance du logiciel Maya ;
  • Excellente connaissance des logiciels de simulation de foule (Houdini Crowd, Golaem) ;
  • Excellent sens des priorités et du respect des délais.


Informations supplémentaires

  • Contrat permanent à temps plein;
  • 5 jours de congé de maladie payé;
  • 2 jours de congé additionnel au temps des Fêtes;
  • Assurances collectives, accès au service en ligne Dialogue et à un programme d’aide aux employés;
  • REER avec cotisation de l'employeur;
  • Rabais avec Bixi, le spa Bota Bota, Nautilus Plus et plusieurs autres entreprises locales.

Diversity is a core value at Rodeo FX. We are passionate about building and sustaining an inclusive and equitable work environment where diversity is celebrated and valued. We believe every member on our team enriches our work by exposing us to a broad range of ways to perceive and interact with the world, identify challenges, and to design and deliver projects.

title: Entertainment Performer - 2022
description:
Overview:

You're born to take centre stage and perform for our guests as part of one of our many AMAZING live productions!

Responsibilities:
  • Performs for guests as a singer, actor, instrumentalist, or variety artist in a performer capacity, as designated by Entertainment Management
  • Rehearses role for assigned show as directed by the production staff
  • Maintain the showâ€™s standards at the highest level by keeping assigned tracks at the performance quality at which the show was directed during several performance times per day, as assigned by park management
  • Pre-set and check condition costumes and props, reports repair needs to the proper personnel
  • Mandatory physical and vocal warm-ups prior to performances to prevent injury
  • Provide guest service according to Cedar Fair standards including initiating guest interactions, answering questions, and giving directions
  • Ensure that all safety standards and practices are met, report any unsafe conditions to supervisors
  • Perform all duties as assigned by Leads, Captains, and Entertainment Management including but not limited to: cleaning the break room and associated backstage areas, retraining, attending meetings, etc.
  • Meets Cedar Fairâ€™s attendance requirements as outlined in Cedar Fairâ€™s attendance policies.
  • Adheres to Cedar Fairâ€™s Rules of Conduct including specific costuming and grooming standards as outlined in Employee Guidelines and other park/division specific policies and procedures
  • Maintain a positive rapport with guests and employees at all times
  • Assist with other duties as required
Qualifications:
  • Candidates must be a minimum of 16 years of age
  • Must pass all audition and/or interview requirements
  • Ability to demonstrate basic acting ability and stage presence
  • Ability to sing, dance, or perform in a theatrical role.
  • Mandatory daily participation in physical and/or vocal warm-ups
  • Maintain a high level of performance to ensure a positive guest experience
  • Able to work outside in a variety of weather conditions
  • Available to work flexible shifts including evenings, weekends, and holidays
  • Abide by all Canadaâ€™s Wonderland policies and procedures as set out by the Park and the Entertainment Department
  • Able to wear personal protective equipment deemed necessary to perform this job safely (may include; gloves, mask and/or face shield, non-slip shoes etc)

title: Part Time Cast Member - Cinema City Movies 12
description:
Job Description

We count on our Cast Members to ensure Cineplex Entertainment provides each and every guest with an exceptional entertainment experience. The Cineplex atmosphere is energetic, big, fast-paced, social, exciting and positive.  

We are currently recruiting part-time positions for this theatre. If you love the movies and enjoy working with the public, then we have opportunities that would be perfect for you. If this is the opportunity you’ve been looking for – Don’t Wait!! Apply Today!

Qualifications

What does it take to be a successful member of the Cineplex Team?

  • You are team oriented Energetic Friendly and outgoing
  • You enjoy working in a fast paced, guest service environment
  • You are available to work late on weekends and some late weeknights
  • You possess superior communication skills
  • Successful candidates will enjoy free movies, competitive wages, flexible hours, tuition assistance and cash incentive programs
  • Pro Serve Certification and being of legal age to serve alcohol in fully licensed theatres would be an asset


Additional Information

Inclusion & Diversity 

Cineplex is an equal opportunity employer with a commitment to hiring and retaining a diverse workforce. We encourage and welcome applications from all intersectional walks of life. The collective sum of our individual differences, experiences, knowledge, innovation, self-expression, unique capabilities, and talent represents a significant part of our culture. By valuing a diverse workforce, we enforce hiring practices that are fair and equitable. 

Life at Cineplex:

Cineplex is synonymous with entertainment. Known as Canada’s largest and most innovative film exhibitor, we’re so much more than movies – operating The Rec Room, Canada’s favourite destination for ‘Eats & Entertainment’ and Playdium, specially designed for teens and families. 

At Cineplex, change and disruption are nothing new. Infusing innovation into everything we do has fueled our evolution as a fully-integrated, diversified and growing organization with exciting career opportunities in our locations and corporate functions. Grow with us and explore roles in operations, food services, hospitality, digital commerce (CineplexStore.com), digital (Cineplex Digital Media) and cinema media (Cineplex Media), consumer loyalty (SCENE), finance, human resources, technology, amusement solutions (Player One Amusement Group), and more.

Proudly recognized as having one of the country’s Most Admired Corporate Cultures, we rally behind our values of Teamwork, Innovation and Excellence. 

We are creative, curious and love thinking big. The next evolution of Cineplex starts here, with you. 

Learn more about our businesses through the links below. 

Cineplex | Cineplex Digital Media |  | Cineplex Media | Cineplex Store | Player One Amusement Group | Playdium | The Rec Room | SCENE 

 

Successful candidates will enjoy free movies, competitive wages, comprehensive training programs, and tuition assistance. If you love the movies and enjoy working with the public, then this opportunity would be perfect for you. Don’t Wait!! Apply Today!

While we appreciate all interest, only those candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.

title: Animateur·trice 3D - Stage Été 2022
description:
As an Animator at Behaviour, you will bring to life a large variety of characters and objects for our game in production. If you want to take part in our project, make sure you submit your portfolio and come play with us!   

In this role you will:

  • Apply effectively animation principles to create high quality animations;
  • Adapt your work  to create new animations based on existing brands; 
  • Edit the animations within a game engine (Unity or Unreal).

What we're looking for:

  • Academic or professionnal experience in making animations demonstrated by your portfolio;
  • Good knowledge of human and creatures anatomy;
  • Knowledge of Maya;
  • Knowledge of Unity/Unreal engine is a plus.
  • Passion for animation and video games;

Dans ce rôle vous devrez:

  • Appliquer de façon efficace les principes de base de l’animation afin de créer un produit de haute qualité;
  • Comprendre les intentions du design de jeu et pouvoir créer les listes d’animations requises pour des personnages simples;
  • Intégrer tes animations dans un moteur de jeu (Unity ou Unreal).

Ce que nous recherchons :

  • Expérience académique ou professionnelle dans la production d’animation dans un jeu vidéo;
  • Portfolio démontrant une bonne connaissance des principes de l’animation ;
  • Bonne connaissance de l’anatomie humaine et des créatures;
  • Expérience avec Maya;
  • Connaissance d’Unity ou Unreal, un atout.

Pour être considéré.e pour cette opportunité de stage tu dois :   
  • Joindre un portfolio à ton application; 
  • Être éligible à travailler au Canada au moment de soumettre ta candidature; 
  • Être disponible pour travailler 37.5 heures par semaines. 

Les dates de stage sont flexibles, dépendamment des besoins d’affaires ainsi que des disponibilités des candidats. 
En tant qu’animateur chez Behaviour, tu donneras vie à une grande variété de personnages et d’objets pour un jeu en production. Si tu veux prendre part à notre projet, assures-toi d’inclure un portfolio au moment de postuler et viens jouer avec nous !
skills: ['Apply effectively animation principles to create high quality animations;', 'Academic or professionnal experience in making animations demonstrated by your portfolio;', 'Good knowledge of human and creatures anatomy;', 'Adapt your work \xa0to create new animations based on existing brands;', 'Edit the animations within a game engine (Unity or Unreal).']

title: Artiste de foules
description:
Description de l'entreprise

En tant qu’entreprise fondée et dirigée par un artiste, notre mission est d'offrir aux talents la liberté et les ressources dont ils ont besoin afin de favoriser la réalisation de travail de qualité et de prospérer dans un environnement amusant et créatif.

  • REER avec cotisation de l'employeur;
  • Rabais avec Bixi, le spa Bota Bota, Nautilus Plus et plusieurs autres entreprises locales.

La diversité est une valeur fondamentale chez Rodeo FX. Créer et maintenir un environnement de travail inclusif et équitable où la diversité est célébrée et valorisée nous tient à coeur. Nous croyons que chaque membre de notre équipe enrichit notre travail en nous exposant à un large éventail de façons de percevoir et d'interagir avec le monde, d'identifier les défis, et de concevoir et réaliser des projets.

title: Volunteer - Entertainer
description:
Job Description :

 

 

ENTERTAINER

Amica Stoney Creek  

 

 

 

Time Commitment: Weekly, biweekly, or monthly

 

 

 

 

Amica Senior Lifestyles is setting a new standard for senior living in Canada by combining unparalleled premium hospitality and amenities with expert care and support to deliver a personalized senior living experience. Committed to enriching the lives of seniors now and as their needs change, Amica offers Independent Living (IL), Assisted Living (AL) and Memory Care (MC) lifestyle options. Established in 1996, the company owns and operates over 30 residences in British Columbia, Alberta and Ontario, with plans to continue expansion in select markets.

 

 

 

A day in the life of an Entertainer

You visit the residence and provide entertainment to a group. You can engage Residents of all abilities in your performance, and provide a repertoire that is appropriate for the demographic. You take pride in connecting and sharing your craft with the Residents.

 

 

Responsibilities and Duties:

You will interact with the Life enrichment team in providing entertainment for our Residents. This may include:

  • Providing entertainment to groups on our different neighbourhoods (Independent Living, Assisted Living and/ or Memory Care)
  • Support Residents in learning a new skill- ex. Teaching guitar, or piano, or ukulele
  • Engaging Residents of all abilities during performance
  • Providing a repertoire that is appropriate to the group

 

Qualifications:

As an Entertainer you demonstrate the following:

  • Passion for providing high quality entertainment to seniors
  • Good verbal communication in English (or other language as required)
  • Proficiency and skill in your genre/ instrument/ skill set
  • Ability to continue performing when there are distractions

Based on the frequency and location of your visits, each volunteer may be required to provide:

  • A Vulnerable Sector Screening from the Police/ RCMP
  • A clear TB test

COVID 19 Protocols:

  • All volunteers will follow COVID 19 protocols in the Residence in alignment with the Team Member strategy (may include masking, hand hygiene training, etc.)

 

Preferred Experience:

  • Experience spending time with seniors (family members, community members, etc.)
  • Experience performing for seniors (community centre, retirement home, long term care, etc.)
  • Looking for:
    • Musicians
      • Individual or group performers
      • Who are interested in teaching seniors their craft
      • Young students looking to practice in front of an audience
    • Other performers    
      • Musicians, jugglers, clowns, comedians, acting groups, etc.

 

Commitment Expected:

We are flexible around commitment and timing for performers- may vary from once or twice per year, to weekly depending on Resident preference.

Duration: Performances typically last between 30 minutes and 1 hour each. Please expect to arrive in advance to welcome attendees and ensure proper set up.

 

 

Training:

We support a vulnerable group of seniors, and as such you may be asked to complete a training process that includes:

  • In person support including:
    • Behaviour management- what to do if you see a Resident experiencing a behavior
    • Emergency Preparedness- should there be an emergency when you are onsite
    • Supporting Residents with Cognitive Aging- Our Residents are all at different places in their aging experience, and some need additional support. We have modules to help you learn how to support and get comfortable with interacting with Residents who may be more forgetful or need more prompting.  
  • Support from our Life Enrichment Coordinator and Team
    • Each LEC helps to guide and support the Entertainers around the needs required for the event
    • Regular touch bases to make sure you have what you need, get your feedback and recommendations.
  • Residence Orientation
    • To help you understand the different areas that are available
    • To prepare and understand what to do in case of emergency
